com.ibm.team.repository.client
Interface ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler

Enclosing interface:
ITeamRepository
public static interface ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler

Handler for acquiring user id and password when a repository is about to be logged in to with #login(), or whenever the repository decides to challenge an already logged-in client (as determined by that repository's security policies).

Nested Class Summary
static interface ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler.ILoginInfo
          Simple data structure encapsulating both a user id and a password.
 
Method Summary
 ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler.ILoginInfo challenge(ITeamRepository repository)
          Displays a message to the user.
 

Method Detail

challenge

ITeamRepository.ILoginHandler.ILoginInfo challenge(ITeamRepository repository)
Displays a message to the user. The receiver should display an appropriate message based on the state of the repository and the last error.

This method may be called from a background thread. The implementer of the method must ensure its thread-safety and avoid displaying the message to the user multiple times if the method gets called simultaneously by multiple threads. This can be achieved by serializing the calls through the use of a lock. In that case special care must be taken to avoid deadlocks; i.e., the challenge method should avoid calling other code that can acquire a lock of any sort. Nesting the acquisition of locks increases the potential for deadlocks.

Parameters:
repository - repository being logged into
Returns:
ILoginInfo the user credentials
